content:
couple of questions.

Is the location in the profile folder? Is it a sub directory of "local folders" in the file system?

Due to the reversal of the \ and / in paths between windows and linux, you should not really copy MSF files from windows.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I did copy the entire profile directory to the the linux machine. Is there a better way to o it and is it documented anywhere?
creator: mike716

content:
onix said
I would like to have either of these options:
  1. Numbered list item Set Get All Messages to Download/Sync now...
  2. Numbered list item A (custom) button on the Toolbar for Download/Sync now...

Like this?

Right click the toolbar and select customize to add the things that are not on the toolbar by default. There are lots of them.

There is also always the keyboard.

While there was a suggestion in this [https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/que.../1387615|thread] to add the following into the Config Editor. It does not work.
  • Bulleted list item 'mail.server.default.check_all_folders_for_new' set as 'TRUE'

That simply tells Thunderbird to synchronise all folders for an IMAP account when it is checking mail. There is a bug that illustrates some of the issues and why it is not enabled by default here https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1659311#c27
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
"Right click the toolbar and select customize to add the things that are not on the toolbar by default. There are lots of them."

There is definitely no such option.

Keyboard shortcut is three layers deep, with ALT + SHIFT + f, plus unreliable other clicks thereafter. That is not what I'm seeking unfortunately.
creator: onix

content:
trisweb said
I apologize in advance, as I am a UX designer and have thought quite a bit about this and have a very clear idea of how it works today, and how it ought to work, and a very confident opinion about several of the workarounds and steps to make it work in the simple logical way it ought to.

In your opinion. Perhaps before you go on you might want to look at the UX discussions, or even contribute. https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/ux

So I will be direct, and I don't really need help or assistance with workarounds or extensions, this is going to be a well-defined post about what Thunderbird needs to do differently to achieve a significantly clearer experience.

Thunderbird has a link on the help menu for feedback and ideas. It goes to this site https://connect.mozilla.org If you want anyone but other users to see your idea, I suggest you post them where the application hosts it's feedback and ideas forum or in a User experience list such as the one I linked to earlier.
creator: MattAuSupport
